title: Sampler, ca. 1820
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, satin and padded satin stitches on plain weave foundation
inscribed: Catharine Cavanagh sampler New York May 23, 18--, 7 years.
provenance: Ex. coll. Fraser-Martin. Bought in New York.
creditline: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection
description:
The center field contains a house, scattered motifs, a verse and inscription, inside a curving strawberry vine border. 
The verse reads: 
Jesus lover of my soul
Let me to thy bosom fly
While the nearer waters roll
While the tempest still is high

Hide me o my saviour hide
Till the storm of life is past
Safe into the haven guide
O receive my soul at last

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, ca. 1820.
ca. 1820. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, satin and padded satin stitches on plain weave foundation. Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection. 1976-100-34.
